title: TAGN Fantasy Critic League 2025 – Week Twenty-Eight Goes Bananza

author: Wilhelm Arcturus

text: We’re around the bend and into the back half of the year as well as being deep into summer, which is traditionally a more sleepy time of the year for releases.  But not this year. Fantasy Critic League – Like Fantasy Football, but for Video Games This past week we saw one of the first big post launch titles for the Nintendo Switch 2 land, Donkey Kong Bananza.  But first, the scores as we left them last week. Week 27 Scores That was how we left things, with week 27 being a sleepy, no launches week.  That changed with week 28, where we got off to a big start mid-week. Donkey Kong Bananza has released! [Picked by Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod)] Now has a score of 90.7 A score of 90+ is a pretty big deal, and that shook up the rankings immediately. Publisher Score Updates Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod) Score has gone UP from 34.7 to 56.3 Moved from 7th place to 4th place Crash and Burn Games (Shawn) Moved from 4th place to 5th place Play Forever Mwahahaha (Shintar) Moved from 5th place to 6th place Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey) Moved from 6th place to 7th place The same say saw another release, RoboCop: Rogue City – Unfinished Business, but it didn’t get enough reviews initially to have a score.  When a score finally landed… well. RoboCop: Rogue City – Unfinished Business [Picked by Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey)] Now has a score of 69.2 The score for RoboCop fluctuated for a bit as new reviews came in and, which it was clearly not getting a lot of love, it did go up a bit. RoboCop: Rogue City – Unfinished Business [Picked by Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey)] Score has gone UP from 69.0 to 71.7 That was just enough to boost Archey up a spot in the scores. Publisher Score Updates Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey) Score has gone UP from 41.8 to 44.5 Moved from 7th place to 6th place Play Forever Mwahahaha (Shintar) Moved from 6th place to 7th place However, Archey’s time in 6th position did not last for long, as Shintar had the week’s third release, Shadow Labyrinth. Shadow Labyrinth has released! [Picked by Play Forever Mwahahaha (Shintar)] Now has a score of 74.3 Also not a stellar score, but enough to put Shintar back in 6th spot on the scoreboard. Publisher Score Updates Play Forever Mwahahaha (Shintar) Score has gone UP from 42.9 to 47.3 Moved from 7th place to 6th place Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey) Moved from 6th place to 7th place All of which left the scoreboard looking like this at the end of the week. Week 28 Scores I remain in 10th position… but will have a title launching… in August.  We’ll get there.  But at least I no longer have the lowest scoring pick in the league.  RoboCop is a point behind Sniper Elite… for now at least. There were no bids this week, so no updates on that front, which brings us to what is coming next week. Coming Up for Week 29 Both Shintar and Kluwes have titles launching next week, on Tuesday and Thursday, so that should lead to at least a bit of change on the scoreboard. As for picks, six of us already have a full slate of picks, while four still have room for additional picks.  Will there be some last minute prized that gets a 2025 release date on which they will be able to pounce? html:
We’re around the bend and into the back half of the year as well as being deep into summer, which is traditionally a more sleepy time of the year for releases.  But not this year.

Fantasy Critic League – Like Fantasy Football, but for Video Games

This past week we saw one of the first big post launch titles for the Nintendo Switch 2 land, Donkey Kong Bananza.  But first, the scores as we left them last week.

Week 27 Scores

That was how we left things, with week 27 being a sleepy, no launches week.  That changed with week 28, where we got off to a big start mid-week.

  • Donkey Kong Bananza has released!
    • [Picked by Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod)]
    • Now has a score of 90.7

A score of 90+ is a pretty big deal, and that shook up the rankings immediately.

  • Publisher Score Updates
    • Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod)
      • Score has gone UP from 34.7 to 56.3
      • Moved from 7th place to 4th place
    • Crash and Burn Games (Shawn)
      • Moved from 4th place to 5th place
    • Play Forever Mwahahaha (Shintar)
      • Moved from 5th place to 6th place
    • Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey)
      • Moved from 6th place to 7th place

The same say saw another release, RoboCop: Rogue City – Unfinished Business, but it didn’t get enough reviews initially to have a score.  When a score finally landed… well.

  • RoboCop: Rogue City – Unfinished Business
    • [Picked by Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey)]
    • Now has a score of 69.2

The score for RoboCop fluctuated for a bit as new reviews came in and, which it was clearly not getting a lot of love, it did go up a bit.

  • RoboCop: Rogue City – Unfinished Business
    • [Picked by Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey)]
    • Score has gone UP from 69.0 to 71.7

That was just enough to boost Archey up a spot in the scores.

  • Publisher Score Updates
    • Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey)
      • Score has gone UP from 41.8 to 44.5
      • Moved from 7th place to 6th place
    • Play Forever Mwahahaha (Shintar)
      • Moved from 6th place to 7th place

However, Archey’s time in 6th position did not last for long, as Shintar had the week’s third release, Shadow Labyrinth.

  • Shadow Labyrinth has released!
    • [Picked by Play Forever Mwahahaha (Shintar)]
    • Now has a score of 74.3

Also not a stellar score, but enough to put Shintar back in 6th spot on the scoreboard.

  • Publisher Score Updates
    • Play Forever Mwahahaha (Shintar)
      • Score has gone UP from 42.9 to 47.3
      • Moved from 7th place to 6th place
    • Frabjous Day Enterprises (Archey)
      • Moved from 6th place to 7th place

All of which left the scoreboard looking like this at the end of the week.

Week 28 Scores

I remain in 10th position… but will have a title launching… in August.  We’ll get there.  But at least I no longer have the lowest scoring pick in the league.  RoboCop is a point behind Sniper Elite… for now at least.

There were no bids this week, so no updates on that front, which brings us to what is coming next week.

Coming Up for Week 29

Both Shintar and Kluwes have titles launching next week, on Tuesday and Thursday, so that should lead to at least a bit of change on the scoreboard.

As for picks, six of us already have a full slate of picks, while four still have room for additional picks.  Will there be some last minute prized that gets a 2025 release date on which they will be able to pounce?

  • TAGN Discord Server
  • Fantasy Critic Site

  • Open Critic Review Site
